intro: Lastrea hookeriana, commonly known as the Hooker's lastrea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to poor soil conditions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in succulent gardens.
